Summary Note:
The Relationship Manager (RM) first met Nørregaard Jespersen at a charity gala in Copenhagen. They had a long conversation about their mutual interest in philanthropy and decided to stay in touch.
Nørregaard Jespersen is a 36 year old Clinical Trials Manager from Denmark.
After extensive research, he chose Julius Baer for its strong track record in managing high-net-worth clients.
Family Background: Nørregaard Jespersen is currently divorced. He does not have any children.
Education Background:
In 2007, Nørregaard finished his secondary school education at Aarhus Katedralskole.
Nørregaard graduated from University of Southern Denmark - Faculty of Engineering in 2012, completing his higher education.
Nørregaard earned his additionally degree from Aarhus University in 2016.
Occupation History:
Nørregaard Jespersen is a 36 year old Clinical Trials Manager from Denmark.
Nørregaard Jespersen launched his career as a Research Scientist at Novo Nordisk A/S, where he gained valuable experience from 2013 to 2018.
His subsequent role was as a Clinical Trials Manager at Lundbeck A/S, where he continued to grow professionally from 2018 till now.
Wealth Summary:
While working, he saved 730000 DKK, which he used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
He owns house in Holbæk, where he resides. It is worth 1780000 DKK.

He purchased villa in Aarhus, where he spends his holidays. It is valued at 2130000 DKK.
Moreover, he has invested in additional property in Gladsaxe, giving possiblity for generating additional income. The house is valued at 2300000 DKK.

In 2018, he received an inheritance of 7740000 DKK from his late grandmother, who was a prominent Private Equity Manager, and has since invested it in various assets.
Client Summary: In summary, Nørregaard has demonstrated a strong work ethic and financial acumen, positioning them well for the future.
